content.description: Face climb that trends left through many nice jugs.
content.location: Follow the cliffline left of the Main Cave <5 min until you reach an open belay area and a small roof. Route is on the face to the right of the small roof.

content.description: Short route with lots of wrapper jugs. Be mindful of your belayer when pulling on the thinner ones.
content.location: First route you will see as you approach the final wall at Sucka left.

content.description: Start on a high jug and move into the 2-tiered roof. Walk out and turn the corner to big holds to the anchors.
content.protection: Standard BD rack up to #3 Anchors with links up top
content.location: Half way to "That almost sucked" stop at the small alcove with the tiered roof.

content.description: Stick clip high first bolt. Climb face, pull roof, work up slab. Great variety of styles within a single short pitch.
content.location: Follow the cliffline left of the Main Cave <5 min until you reach an open belay area and a small roof. Route named for the small roof 2/3 up.

content.description: Start on a chest-high shelf and move up the face keeping the arete close by.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a set of anchors.
content.location: Left of the Main Cave follow the wall to the first prominent arete.

content.description: Great movement on albeit miserable grips. Start on jugs and utilize tiny holds with big feet to snatch a good edge in the roof (V5/6). Clip and then work more angry little crimps and knobs to gain a rail out right (V5-) and go to the top. Skipping bolts 3 and 4 makes things a bit easier. Climbs like a long V7-
content.location: Left of the main cave. The only thing over there that looks hard.

content.description: Short cliffline often capped with a roof. While almost all other routes are constantly shaded this area gets afternoon sun.
